channel.title: Requesting Developers & Anyone with a passion for programming
channel.description:
[CENTER][COLOR=blue][SIZE=5][FONT=Century Gothic]Project Olympus[/SIZE][/COLOR]
[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/iH1xbyO.jpg?2[/img][/CENTER]
[LEFT][COLOR=navy]We Fallian, are in the process of making a game that will hopefully rival Runescape itself in good time. No more of the RSPS competition between each other with little to no differences in game play. Here's a few things we are planning on doing to give you an idea. We are trying to make something truly unique by starting with the actual game Runescape. We are planning on making everything work in the game just as it does in RS; Pre-Eoc because that was their downfall primarily. After we get done and have a 100% working game we plan on using that source as a base, for a new game we can mold. We plan on making our own game out of a working Runescape Base. We have tons of idea's and tons of dedication put into this project. We are just short on Developers.
However, we have the same communication/collaboration tools as the biggest game developing teams in the business (for example, Blizzard Entertainment). We use: Atlassian JIRA (Issue Tracker), Atlassian Confluence (Enterprise Wiki/Knowledge Base/Documentation), Atlassian Bitbucket Server (In-house Git), IntelliJ IDEA Ultimate, JavaRebel (Improved JVM HotSwapping), Atlassian HipChat which integrates directly with the World, Lobby, and Authentication Servers, AMQP for Server-to-Server-(to-client) communication, MariaDB as our database engine, and much more. Most of these tools are smartphone compatible. All accounting is handled through a central authentication server that has a proprietary OAuth2 server implementation, Restful API, and multi-factored authentication. Our team name is Registered and Trademarked by the parent company, (VIONOX Inc.).
As for pay, Right now no one on the team is being paid due to lack of funds. [B]Once we are fully online and running we will be paying the developers [/B]for their previous work done, and then from there on. Right now we are in our Pre-Alpha Stage, Scheduled for an Open Alpha Release Soon.[/COLOR]
[COLOR=purple][B]If you’re interested, message me and we can discuss any more details that I have either left out, or you are curious about.[/B][/COLOR]
[b][COLOR=purple]Some Things We Would Like In A Developer:[/COLOR]
[ul][COLOR=teal] [*]Dedication [*]Passion for any kind of development [*]Friendly [*]Experience is preferred, But is not a requirement.[/ul]
[b][COLOR=purple]Things you need to join our team:[/COLOR]
[ul][COLOR=teal] [*]A Computer [*]A Keyboard [*]A Mouse [*]And commitment to our Team.[/ul]
[b][COLOR=purple]Types of developers needed:[/COLOR]
[ul][COLOR=teal] [*]Java Programmer/Any Kind of Programmer. [*]Website Developer [*]3D-Modeler [*]Anyone that wants to help further the project in any way.[/ul]
[SIZE=3][COLOR=purple]We are willing to teach anyone who wants to learn.[/COLOR][/SIZE] [/LEFT]
[CENTER][COLOR=blue][SIZE=5]Tools we are in need of at the moment[/SIZE][/COLOR] [SIZE=4] [COLOR=maroon][B]---- 718 Map Editor ----[/B][/COLOR] [/SIZE] [COLOR=blue][SIZE=2]If you have any of these tools and are willing to sell, please message me asap.[/SIZE][/COLOR] [/CENTER]

item.title: Requesting Developers & Anyone with a passion for programming
item.dc:creator: @slimdragon50 slimdragon50
item.description:
@slimdragon50 wrote:

my-swagger:

What’s training when you’re buying tools?

I was talking about our programming tools, not the map editing tool we are currently looking for, we obviously need one to add different areas to the game and edit current ones. If we are unable to find one we will have to make one ourselves or rewrite a lower revision editor.

Read full topic
item.source: Requesting Developers & Anyone with a passion for programming

item.title: Requesting Developers & Anyone with a passion for programming
item.dc:creator: @slimdragon50 slimdragon50
item.description:
@slimdragon50 wrote:

sini:

Training someone to work in this sort of environment takes too much of a commitment and is a pipe dream.

Are you referring to our tools, or are you referring to when i said “We will teach anyone willing to learn”?

Read full topic

item.title: Requesting Developers & Anyone with a passion for programming
item.dc:creator: @slimdragon50 slimdragon50
item.description:
@slimdragon50 wrote:

[quote=“sini, post:10, topic:553811”][quote]
Things you need to join our team:

A Computer
A Keyboard
A Mouse
And commitment to our Team.
[/quote]

I mean. You post something professional, get professional sounding posts back. Post this, and yeah.[/quote]

This is a professional post, its worded correctly, formatted correctly, & everything is grammatically correct. Putting that meant anyone can join the team, all you need is commitment. If that changes your perception of whether or not its professional, then i am sorry i confused you. Thanks for the feedback though

Tree, I understand that’s how you feel about the project but that’s okay of course everyone is entitled to their own opinions Like always constructive criticism is welcome.

Read full topic
item.source: Requesting Developers & Anyone with a passion for programming

item.dc:creator: @Tree Tree
item.description:
@Tree wrote:

There’s a few of us who work in the industry and can spot a rotton tomato fairly easily.
We are upfront, that’s all.

Read full topic

item.title: Requesting Developers & Anyone with a passion for programming
item.dc:creator: @slimdragon50 slimdragon50
item.description:
@slimdragon50 wrote:

[quote=“Coldmedicine, post:8, topic:553811”]Why the fudge does everyone on Mopar and R-S always have to f*cking flame?
Just let the dude run his freaking project and let him.
If you dont like it, how hard can it be to NOT touch the reply button?

Jesus christ.[/quote]

It’s just how people are, i don’t mind it. Thank you for addressing that though, I wasn’t to eager to fuel him.

Read full topic

item.source: Requesting Developers & Anyone with a passion for programming

item.title: Requesting Developers & Anyone with a passion for programming
item.dc:creator: @slimdragon50 slimdragon50
item.description:
@slimdragon50 wrote:

WarTusk-RSPS lack of funds is never a good thing to put when trying to recruit people.
I understand your concern, however i would rather tell people that from the start rather then lie to them or wait for them to ask that question themselves. I do agree it isn't ideal for most programmers to want to join a team when they see we cannot pay yet. But even with that in mind, we have still gotten people who are willing to invest their time into our project. By the way, Lack of funds in terms of being able to pay for all our developers, we have funds just they are for the things that are vital to keeping the project at a constantly progressing rate. Thank you for the feedback :)

Read full topic
item.source: Requesting Developers & Anyone with a passion for programming
